Dear Michael Centi:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
8/09/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all of
the following information prior to employment or at the
time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of
human services, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides, that the
person has not been determined to be a perpetrator
of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
2

shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to
the start of employment and every 12 months
thereafter.
Three of three ongoing employee files reviewed failed to document the completion
of an updated central registry clearance.
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for
new employees. Job shadowing shall not be the only
form of orientation. The orientation shall include the
following:
(a) The institution's purpose, policies, and
procedures, including discipline, crisis intervention
techniques, and emergency and safety procedures.
Five of five new employee files reviewed failed to document that an organized
orientation program was provided or completed by new employees.
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person
whose function is covered by these rules has
participated in a minimum of 50 clock hours of planned
training within the first year of employment and a
minimum of 25 clock hours of training annually thereafter
related to the employee's job function. At least 16 of the
50 hours provided in the first year shall be orientation
provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Three of three employee files reviewed failed to document the completion of 25
hours of annual training.
CCI Rule 400.4152 Initial documentation
(1) At the time of admission, all of the following shall be
in the resident's case record:
(i) Documentation that the grievance policy was
provided as required in R 400.4132.
One of four youth files reviewed failed to document that the grievance policy was
provided.
3

CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
(4) The social service worker shall sign and date the
initial treatment plan.
Two of four youth files reviewed did not include the signature and date of the
social services worker on the initial plan.
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
(5) The social service supervisor shall approve,
countersign, and date the initial treatment plan.
Two of four youth files did not include a signature and/or date of the social service
supervisor on the initial plan.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at least
once every 90-calendar days following the initial
treatment plan.
Two of four youth updated service plans were not completed within the required
90-day time frame.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(5) The social service supervisor shall approve,
countersign, and date the updated treatment plan.
One of four updated service plans for the youth reviewed did not include the
signature of the supervisor as required.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care,
all of the following information shall be documented in
the case record within 14 days after discharge:
4

(e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental
follow up that is needed, have been reviewed with
the resident and with the parent and with the
responsible case manager.
Eight of the eight closed case files reviewed failed to documentation or a
statement that the discharge plan recommendations were reviewed with the
resident, parent and case manager.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The Sanctuary is operated under Lighthouse of Oakland County. The agency has
501(c)3 status. Their financial audit was reviewed and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was received and reviewed on 09/16/2024.
Assessment indicates there were not any barriers or systemic factors impacting
rule compliance. Staff continues to work toward enhancing treatment for youth in
the program. The program had a new program director and program manager for
this fiscal year.
5

Staff and Youth Interviews
A total of three staff were interviewed. All staff expressed feeling supported by the
agency. Staff were able to explain/discuss major policy and procedures for The
Sanctuary. No concerns were reported.
Youth were interviewed and no concerns were expressed. Youth reported feeling
safe and supported at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency was found to be well maintained. No areas of concern were noted.
Both staff and youth were observed taking step to keep the space well maintained.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
